dynamic_line: That faith is the worship of the old Norse gods.  I know it might sound pretty crazy, but I believe that the prophecies of the old ways had something to them, especially now with the craziness that's going on.  If that's correct, why wouldn't the other parts of it be too?  I believe that a return to these old ways will help us, and bring us closer to the Gods.

dynamic_line: This is where we live these days.  It's a giant fortess that U Amherst wanted to make into a reenactment place, a sort of living histroy project.  We put on finishing touches when we got here and started living out of it, hauling anything we might scavenege back here.  We've done pretty well for ourselves, haven't had any problems with <zombie>s or bandits yet.

dynamic_line.yes: Half of us were from the Ag-Sci program at U Amherst, we'd heard some friends talk about a living histroy program the university ran here, a fortress modeled after Viking structures. When things got really hairy we started wandering this direction.  It was a hell of a journey and we lost several of our friends and found some other refugees on the way.  Others have come and gone since then, but we've held out.
dynamic_line.no: I came from one of those government evac camps, when things all went <swear> sideways.  A bunch of us jumped ship before everything went down, and we met a group of grad students wandering down this way.  One of them was really into Norse stuff, started preaching about religion and gods, quite the convincing individual.  We heard they were going to some sort of fortress, so we opted to follow the.
